section.title: Audience
section.para: Welcome to this Webcampak user guide.
This document has been created to detail Webcampak and contains details about all functionalities available.

section.title: What is Webcampak ?
section.para: Webcampak is a device aimed to automatically capture, store and process pictures initially created to be used with DSLR cameras.
Our product has evolved and is compatible with a wide range of devices:
Being compatible with high-end DSLR cameras, Webcampak can process very high quality pictures when connected to an appropriate camera (not all DSLR are compatible).
Canon point-and-shoot cameras, sold after 2009, are not compatible anymore but you can still find such camera on the second-hand market for a fraction of their original price.

section.title: Communication
section.para: Webcampak has been conceived right from the beginning to be network-enabled. It is compatible with various types of links:
Some Internet links (especially wireless) are subject to FUP (Fair Use Policy) limiting the amount of data to be transmitted each month. Webcampak can fit almost any FUP limitations by:

listitem.para: Sending a fraction of captured pictures (for example, send 1 out of 5 pictures)
Reducing pictures resolution of pictures sent over network

section.para: By adjusting those parameters you can limit the amount of data to be transferred and therefore be compliant with your provider's FUP.

section.title: Picture quality
section.para: Webcampak compatible with all Canon DSLR cameras and associated lenses.
Picture quality during day or night time will be very close (if not identical) to quality that can be obtained by a professional photographer for a single shot.
Take in consideration that some cameras and/or lenses might required Webcampak adjustments (might require a larger enclosure due to lens size).

section.title: Webcampak versions
section.para: There is only one Webcampak solution, but our product is available in two different models:

listitem.para: Webcampak: is an automated capture device in an all-weather enclosure.
Webcampak-Pro: is a concentration point for pictures, it can process a potentially unlimited number of sources. It has been created to be installed in an IT room or a datacenter.

section.para: Both models are equipped with the exact same software, the only difference being physical elements (all-weather enclosure, amount of RAM, CPU, ...).

section.title: Sources
section.para: Webcampak core is associated to the concept of "sources", giving it adaptability and scalability.

A Webcampak source is a configuration process aimed to capture and process pictures. A source is not necessarily attached to a capture device (such as a camera), the capture can come from another Webcampak or another source from the same Webcampak.
It allows sources to be cascaded and to potentially modify one single picture an unlimited number of times.
Let's take a real world example:

At a building site, the building company would like to generate a timelapse video of the whole construction project and at the same time, publish real-time pictures on its website to show building progress to its customers.
Those two requirements need different pictures:

listitem.para: For a timelapse video, pictures must be stored in the highest quality with a limited number of manipulations (no legend, no watermark, ...).
For real-time picture web-publishing, the construction company would like pictures to include the company's logo and a capture date.

section.para: Therefore Webcampak has to process pictures differently, this can be done by cascading sources.

A first source will capture the picture from the camera and store it for the timelapse video. This source will also send pictures to a second source. This second source will process the picture, insert a logo, date, resize it and send it to the company's website.
All of this is done automatically by Webcampak with no human action past the initial configuration.

section.title: Files
section.para: Your Webcampak will probably have to store a (very) large number of pictures. It has been designed for this task and multiple features are available to manage and secure those files.

section.title: Redundancy
section.para: Always keep in mind that hardware failure or human error (i.e. delete pictures by mistake) can happen and it's always better to take precautions before such events happen.

Webcampak is able to send pictures to remote FTP server, you can also store pictures automatically to another source of the same Webcampak to prevent human errors (just take in consideration that it will require twice the amount of disk space).
Other mechanisms are available using third party products, we will study those with you based upon your requirements.

section.title: Automated deletion
section.para: Webcampak is equipped with automated deletion mechanisms to ensure its internal hard disk never runs out of space. Those mechanisms can be configured to fit various requirements.

When Webcampak store its pictures to a remote server, it can use its internal disk space as a buffer to ensure no pictures are lost in case of network issue. Depending of the capture frequency and picture size, this buffer size can cover multiple days, even months.

section.title: File structure
section.para: Webcampak is equipped with multiple directory structures.

section.title: Global FTP account
section.para: A global FTP account, shared with between sources will let you access:

listitem.para: /audio/ : directory for mp3 and/or m3u files, used to add an audio track to your videos.
/cache/ : directory with temporary files, all files in this directory can be deleted in case of issue.
/logs/ : directory hosting system's logs for all sources.
/watermark/ : directory for watermark files to be added to pictures and/or videos.

section.title: Per-source FTP account
section.para: Each source has its own FTP account, with the following directory structure:

listitem.para: /live/ : directory hosting hotlink pictures and videos.
/pictures/process-video/ : temporary directory, deleted automatically when a new video is created.
/pictures/process-videocustom/: temporary directory, deleted automatically when a new custom video is created.
/pictures/process-videopost/ : temporary directory, deleted automatically when a new post-prod. video process is initiated.
/tmp/ : pictures coming from IP cameras or other Webcampak must be uploaded to this directory to be processed by Webcampak.
